work.title: Bioinformatics Specialist
description: Gained diverse project experience, working with single-cell RNA-seq data, bulk RNA-seq data, structural molecular data, and phylogenentic data.
Developed a protein structure analysis tool using KNN clustering and matplotlib for interactive visualization of local RMSD calculations between AlphaFold-generated structures.
Architected containerized environments using Docker for reproducible single-cell RNAseq analysis workflows.
Automated RNA-seq transcriptome assembly pipeline, resulting in 8x productivity speed-up.
Implemented a 7-day rolling backup solution using hard links for storage optimization.
Set up RAID arrays for high-availability storage infrastructure.
Created technical documentation and architecture diagrams using Freeform to visually communicate complex workflows to stakeholders.

work.title: XN Rising Program Intern
description: Developed an accessible bibliographic reference parser in collaboration with four other students and a project sponsor from Pfizer using regex and open-source machine learning packages.
Produced a ground truth bibliographic reference dataset for all articles on PubMed (33 million entries) using web scraping with multithreading, reducing download time from days to hours.

work.title: Research Assistant
work.company: Digital Scholarship Center at University of Cincinnati
description: Built text classifiers using scikit-learn and BERT to answer research questions.
Produced usable, large-scale datasets via API pulls, web scraping, and data cleaning
Coordinated weekly with team leader on multiple concurrent projects.
